result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lacy A. TADDY

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

Defendant in custody on probation hold.
The State moves to dismiss and read in this charge.  The defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 89, 14 CM 198 and 15 CM 136.  Motion granted.
$1,000.00 cash bail transferred to 15 CM 136 and applied to court costs and restitution.
Minutes.
RE: Defendant's withdrawal of plea of Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
Plea Date set for 10-08-2015 at 2:15 p.m., Br. 2.
Letter from Attorney Lambrecht to GLB.
Order for Examination Under 971.16.

Order to Seal.
It is ordered that the Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report performed by Jenna Hernke, Psy.D. received on 07-29-15 be and is hereby sealed by order of this court and shall be opened by the court only upon agreement of the parties and their counsel.
Report of Jenna Hernke, Psy.D.  (located in case no: 14 CM 198)
From Attorney Lambrecht to Judge Bendix.

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services.
Hearing is set for 08-12-15 at 8:30 a.m.

The defendant wishes to change her pleas from not guilty to one of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on all charges.
The Court orders an examination and will appoint an examiner.
